posts.text: The Senate can expell members but it is very rare.

It is not that they don't have a BS meter. They chose to ignore it when it doesn't match their desires. The problem is there is a ready supply for any market of desire and people will stick to what they want not what they need.
That would be correct. Also keep in mind many Medicare patients have secondary private insurance to augment the Medicare coverage.

Possibly but that is the argument. Medicare tends to run with lower costs than private insurance so it should be cheaper. But can private insurance yield to competitive pressure and lower costs?

The big driver of insurance cost is health care itself.
The public option is not free. You still pay for it.

Never argue. You will not change minds and it is a waste of time. Your time is to be used to find those that may or will vote Biden. If you do get a negative person politely move on.

You will get training. Welcome to campaigning and have fun.
